                                                     NYU Box Office       YOUR TICKET TO NEW YORK CITY                                   The official ticketing service for the University, NYU Box Office sells tickets to events on and off campus and is the home of Ticket Central , an exclusive service for the NYU Community which provides access to tickets to the movies, Broadway and Off-Broadway shows, sporting events, musical concerts and more, all at a reduced price!                    Ticket Central Each week, Ticket Central offers tickets to Broadway and Off-Broadway shows, sports games, and other NYC events. Read More                NYU Skirball Events World-class music, theater, dance, comedy, film right here on Washington Square—and student tickets are $15 or less! Read More                 Campus Events Check out our calendar of on-campus concerts, cultural events, celebrations, lectures and more! Read More                Group Tickets NYU Box Office can help you purchase group tickets to many events on and off campus! Read More                                 NYU Ticket Central Mailing List   With so much going on at NYU Ticket Central, the best way to keep informed of our specials, discounts, bargains and give-aways is to join our email listserv!     How to join:   You can enter your email address here and you will be added to the listserv automatically.                                                   Email:           Please check your spelling and hit submit only once!                          Submit                          Contact Us   Box Office Location:  566 LaGuardia Place  (Side entrance of the Kimmel Center)   Phone: 212.998.4941  Fax: 212.995.4961  Email: boxoffice@nyu.edu   Fall/Spring Hours:   Tuesday – Saturday,  noon–6:00pm   Closed on University holidays and breaks                                            NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. TV Nation: Inside and Out of the Box: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        TV Nation: Inside and Out of the Box  FMTV-UT.1086 Studio 3 Credits Instructor(s): Check Albert TV Nation: Inside and Out of the Box gives students the opportunity to experience, first hand, how the world of network television works from two points of view: business and creative. Students will gain an understanding of the business aspect through the vantage point of the network executives and programmers. They will also learn the creative process from development to pitching, from the vantage point of writers and producers in the industry. In TV Nation, student will role-play the entire process as the key players who put together a season of broadcast and cable networks.    Please note there is a non-refundable $16.00 per credit fee for this course. If you are a non-major, please make sure to register for the section for non-majors, generally considered section .002. Check Albert for course schedule.   Electives (9 Points)  Minor in Producing           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? TV NATION: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        TV Nation: Inside and Out of the Box  FMTV-UT.1086 Studio 3 Credits Film and Television Majors register for H56.1086.01    Non-Majors register for H56.1086.02    Graduate-level students register for H56.2086.01    TV NATION: INSIDE AND OUT OF THE BOX gives students the opportunity to experience first hand how the world of network television works from two points of view: business and creative. Under the business umbrella are network programmers. Under the creative umbrella are writers, producers and casting directors. In TV NATION, students will role-play the key players who put together a season for the 8 major networks.
